page.title: 13HANDICAP CENTRE, HENLLAN (1)
page.content: The Henllan Adult Training Centre serves the Glyndwr and Colwyn distri- cts of Clwyd. It provides for 100 mentally- and physically-handicapped students aged 16+,whose attendance ranges from 10 years to a lifetime. When it opened in 1970, the Centre was residential but the trainees now trav- el from parental or social service homes.Within the building there is a special care unit for ten severely handicapped people. The staff of twenty-three includes 11 teachers who train the students to become self-reliant & independent.The Centre provides a range of experience: -domestic,e.g.laundry work, cookery; -social, e.g.shopping, conversation; -work exp,e.g.gardening, painting, woodwork, pottery; -leisure, e.g.sport,crochet,music; -academic,e.g.literacy, numeracy.
